img_source: Henry Vandyke Carter, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 在張口換氣時協助打開下顎，並穩定舌骨位置。良好的控制能確保在極短的換氣窗口內吸入最大氣量。
desc_en: Assists in jaw opening during breathing and stabilizes the hyoid. Good control ensures maximum air intake within the very short breathing window.

img_source: Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 蝶式空中回臂（Recovery）的主要升力來源。在自由式中，協助提肘（High Elbow Recovery）動作，確保手臂順利出水。
desc_en: Primary lift source for butterfly recovery. In freestyle, assists in the High Elbow Recovery, ensuring the arm clears the water smoothly.

img_source: Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 負責空中移臂（Recovery）後的入水延伸（Reach）。將手臂向前送出以增加划距（Distance Per Stroke）。過度使用或圓肩容易導致夾擠症候群。
desc_en: Responsible for the reach after aerial recovery. Drives the arm forward to maximize Distance Per Stroke. Overuse or rounded shoulders can lead to impingement syndrome.

img_source: Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 在划手結束後的「提臂出水」階段至關重要。將手臂向後上方拉起，啟動回臂動作。疲勞時手肘會抬不起來（拖水）。
desc_en: Crucial for lifting the arm out of the water at the end of the stroke. Pulls the arm back and up to initiate recovery. Fatigue here causes low elbows (water dragging).

img_source: Berichard, CC BY-SA 3.0, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 強大的伸髖與內收肌。在蝶式打腿的下壓（Downbeat）與蛙式夾水動作中均扮演重要角色，提供深層且強勁的推進力。
desc_en: Powerful hip extensor and adductor. Plays a major role in both the butterfly downbeat and breaststroke squeeze, providing deep, robust propulsion.

img_source: Henry Vandyke Carter, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 被稱為「背闊肌的小助手」。全力協助自由式與蝶式的划水動作（內旋與伸展）。在衝刺時提供額外的爆發力。
desc_en: Known as the 'Lat's Little Helper'. Fully assists in the pulling motion (internal rotation and extension) of freestyle and butterfly. Provides extra explosive power during sprints.

img_source: Henry Vandyke Carter, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 微調手掌寬度。部分游泳教練主張手指微張（約2-3mm）能利用流體邊界層效應增加抓水力，此肌肉負責控制該張開幅度。
desc_en: Fine-tunes hand width. Some coaches advocate for slight finger spreading (~2-3mm) to leverage fluid boundary layer effects for better grip; this muscle controls that spread.

img_source: Henry Vandyke Carter, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 維持小指伸直以增加划水表面積。在自由式入水時，小指通常先入水（視技術流派而定），此肌肉需負責精確控制。
desc_en: Keeps the little finger extended to increase stroke surface area. In freestyle entry (depending on technique), the little finger often enters first, requiring precise control by this muscle.

img_source: Henry Vandyke Carter, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 協助維持手掌外側（尺側）的張力。在抱水時，有助於捕捉更多水流。
desc_en: Assists in maintaining tension on the lateral (ulnar) side of the palm. Helps trap more water during the catch.

img_source: Henry Vandyke Carter, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 稍微增加手掌的凹陷度（Cupping）。雖然過度杯狀手不被推薦，但適度的對立能增加抓水時的穩定感。
desc_en: Slightly increases palm cupping. While excessive cupping is discouraged, moderate opposition enhances stability during the catch.

img_source: Henry Vandyke Carter, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 在游泳時通常保持放鬆。但在蛙式踢水時，些微的外展有助於最大化腳掌對水的接觸面積。
desc_en: Usually relaxed during swimming. However, during the breaststroke kick, slight abduction helps maximize the plantar surface area against the water.

img_source: Henry Vandyke Carter, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 肩袖穩定肌。協助棘下肌進行外旋，在手臂高肘抱水（EVF）時，對抗強大的內旋力矩，保持關節穩定。
desc_en: Rotator cuff stabilizer. Assists the infraspinatus in external rotation. During the Early Vertical Forearm (EVF) catch, counters strong internal rotation torque to maintain joint stability.

img_source: Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 負責在水中用力呼氣（吐氣泡）。有效的呼氣是快速吸氣的前提，此肌肉確保廢氣能迅速排出，防止二氧化碳堆積。
desc_en: Responsible for forceful exhalation (blowing bubbles) underwater. Effective exhalation is the prerequisite for fast inhalation; this muscle ensures rapid CO2 expulsion.

img_source: Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 與咬肌協同。緊張的下顎會連帶影響頸部肌肉，破壞頭部流線型位置。放鬆下顎是改善換氣效率的第一步。
desc_en: Synergistic with the masseter. A tense jaw recruits neck muscles, disrupting the streamlined head position. Relaxing the jaw is the first step to improving breathing efficiency.

img_source: Henry Vandyke Carter, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 在入水延伸（Entry and Extension）階段穩定手腕尺側。防止手掌向外翻轉，確保切入水面的角度正確。
desc_en: Stabilizes the ulnar side of the wrist during Entry and Extension. Prevents outward hand deviation, ensuring the correct angle for slicing into the water.

img_source: Henry Vandyke Carter, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 與橈側腕屈肌共同完成推水動作。同時在抱水初期（Catch）協助手腕微彎，以利捕捉水流。
desc_en: Works with the radialis to complete the push phase. Also assists in slight wrist flexion during the initial Catch to help trap water.

img_source: Berichard d'après Gray's anatomy, CC BY-SA 3.0, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 輔助足部穩定。在強力轉身蹬牆（Wall Push-off）時協助調整足部受力，避免力量分散。
desc_en: Assists in foot stability. Helps align foot force application during powerful wall push-offs, preventing power dissipation.

img_source: Selket at English Wikipedia, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 游泳「高肘抱水 (EVF)」的關鍵肌。在抓水瞬間負責將前臂旋前（內旋），使手掌與前臂能垂直於水面，大幅提升推進效率。
desc_en: Key muscle for 'Early Vertical Forearm (EVF)'. Pronates the forearm at the catch, positioning the palm and forearm perpendicular to the water surface for maximum propulsion.

img_source: Polygon data is generated by Database Center for Life Science (DBCLS), CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 協助長時間維持足部伸直的流線型姿勢。在長距離游泳中，防止腳板不自覺勾起（Dorsiflexion）而產生巨大的阻力剎車效應。
desc_en: Helps maintain the streamlined pointed-foot position over time. In distance swimming, prevents unconscious dorsiflexion which would create a massive drag/braking effect.

img_source: BodyParts3D/Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 在蛙式收腿（Recovery）時負責屈膝將腳跟拉向臀部。在自由式中，協助上踢（Upbeat）動作，並維持腿部的流線型位置。
desc_en: Responsible for knee flexion during the breaststroke recovery, pulling heels toward the glutes. In freestyle, assists in the upbeat phase and maintains streamlined leg positioning.

img_source: Uwe Gille, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 維持腳趾平順的關鍵。避免腳趾蜷曲（Clawing），確保水流能順暢通過腳面，減少微小渦流阻力。
desc_en: Key to keeping toes streamlined. Prevents toe clawing, ensuring smooth water flow over the foot surface and minimizing micro-eddy drag.

img_source: Image:Gray445.png modified by Uwe Gille, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 在游泳時應保持放鬆。許多初學者因腳部過度緊張而導致此肌肉與足底筋膜緊繃，引發足底抽筋。
desc_en: Should remain relaxed while swimming. Many beginners experience plantar cramping due to excessive tension in this muscle and the plantar fascia.

img_source: modified by Uwe Gille, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 在蹬牆出發（Push-off）時提供足弓穩定。游泳過程中若腳趾過度用力抓水（非必要動作），容易導致此肌肉痙攣（抽筋）。
desc_en: Provides arch stability during wall push-offs. Excessive toe gripping while swimming (unnecessary) often leads to spasms (cramps) in this muscle.

img_source: Henry Vandyke Carter, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 游泳時的重要肌肉。負責將拇指緊貼食指邊緣，消除指間縫隙，創造一個堅實、不漏水的划手槳面。
desc_en: Vital for swimming. Keeps the thumb tight against the index finger, eliminating gaps to create a solid, leak-proof paddle for pulling.

img_source: Henry Vandyke Carter, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 控制入水時的手掌張力。適度的外展有助於形成穩定的划手槳面（Paddle），但過度僵硬會導致前臂疲勞。
desc_en: Controls hand tension at entry. Moderate abduction helps form a stable paddle shape, but excessive stiffness leads to forearm fatigue.

img_source: Henry Vandyke Carter, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 穩定拇指基部。在划手遭遇強大水阻時，防止拇指塌陷或移位，維持手掌結構的完整性。
desc_en: Stabilizes the thumb base. Prevents thumb collapse or shifting under heavy water resistance during the pull, maintaining hand structural integrity.

img_source: Henry Vandyke Carter, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 負責拇指伸展。游泳時避免拇指過度外展（翹起），這會增加水阻。應保持拇指與手掌平面一致。
desc_en: Extends the thumb. Avoid excessive abduction (hitchhiking) while swimming, as it increases drag. Keep the thumb aligned with the palm plane.

img_source: Henry Vandyke Carter, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 協助控制拇指位置。在划手時，拇指通常需貼近食指以減少縫隙，此肌肉需適度調節張力。
desc_en: Assists in controlling thumb position. During the stroke, the thumb should usually be close to the index finger to minimize gaps; this muscle regulates tension appropriately.

img_source: Henry Vandyke Carter, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 強化大魚際區的穩定性。防止划水時拇指因疲勞而鬆動，確保每一划的效率。
desc_en: Reinforces stability in the thenar eminence. Prevents the thumb from loosening due to fatigue during strokes, ensuring efficiency in every pull.

img_source: Henry Vandyke Carter, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 協助拇指稍微向手掌中心旋轉，這有助於鎖定拇指位置，使其成為堅固划手面的一部分。
desc_en: Assists in rotating the thumb slightly toward the palm center, helping lock the thumb position as part of a solid stroke surface.

name_zh: 拇趾外展肌（內在肌視角）
img_source: modified by Uwe Gille, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 與足部流體力學有關。在蛙式蹬腿（Kick）瞬間，穩定的足部內側結構有助於更有效地推水。
desc_en: Related to foot hydrodynamics. A stable medial foot structure enhances water displacement efficiency during the propulsive phase of the breaststroke kick.

img_source: Polygon data were generated by Database Center for Life Science (DBCLS)[2], CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 負責自由式與蝶式打腿的「上踢（Upbeat）」準備動作（屈膝與伸髖）。在蛙式中，負責收腿時的屈膝動作。
desc_en: Responsible for the 'upbeat' preparation (knee flexion/hip extension) in freestyle/fly kicks. In breaststroke, handles knee flexion during recovery.

img_source: BodyParts3D/Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 提供膝關節伸展的純粹力量。在所有泳姿的推水/踢水階段，負責將彎曲的膝蓋強力打直，對抗水的阻力。
desc_en: Provides pure power for knee extension. In the push/kick phase of all strokes, responsible for forcibly straightening the flexed knee against water resistance.

img_source: BodyParts3D/Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 負責膝關節伸展的最後階段。在蛙式踢腿結束雙腿併攏伸直時，負責鎖定膝蓋，維持流線型並保護髕骨穩定。
desc_en: Responsible for the final degrees of knee extension. Locks the knee when legs close together at the end of the breaststroke kick, maintaining streamline and patellar stability.

img_source: BodyParts3D/Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 協助髖關節外旋。在蛙式收腿末端，協助定位大腿以利進行最強力的蹬夾動作。
desc_en: Assists in hip external rotation. At the end of the breaststroke recovery, helps position the thigh for the most powerful whip kick.

img_source: BodyParts3D/Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 股四頭肌中最大的部分，提供打腿的主要爆發力。在轉身蹬牆（Push-off）時，它是產生初速度的最關鍵肌肉。
desc_en: Largest part of the quads, providing main explosive power for kicking. During wall push-offs, it is the most critical muscle for generating initial velocity.

img_source: BodyParts3D/Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 自由式與仰式打腿的關鍵雙關節肌。負責屈髖（仰式上踢/自由式下壓準備）並強力伸膝（踢水）。是產生鞭狀打水動作的核心。
desc_en: Key biarticular muscle for freestyle/backstroke kicks. Flexes the hip (backstroke up-kick/free downbeat prep) and powerfully extends the knee (the kick). Core to the whip-like kicking action.

img_source: BodyParts3D/Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 跨越雙關節的內收肌。在蛙式踢腿時，除了協助夾腿，還幫助控制膝蓋的屈曲角度，防止膝關節在強力踢水時受傷。
desc_en: Biarticular adductor. During breaststroke kick, besides assisting the squeeze, it helps control knee flexion angle, preventing injury during powerful kicks.

img_source: Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 肩袖中唯一的內旋肌。在強力的划水（Pull）階段，保護肩關節前側，防止肱骨頭向前滑動。游泳肩痛常涉及此肌肉的肌腱病變。
desc_en: The only internal rotator of the cuff. During the powerful Pull phase, protects the anterior shoulder, preventing anterior humeral glide. Swimmer's shoulder often involves tendinopathy here.

img_source: Berichard, CC BY-SA 3.0, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 連結肩胛骨與頸部。在自由式划手（肩胛骨活動）與換氣（頸部活動）之間協調筋膜張力，確保呼吸道通暢。
desc_en: Connects scapula to neck. Coordinates fascial tension between arm pulls (scapular movement) and breathing (neck movement) in freestyle, ensuring an open airway.

img_source: Bildbearbetning: sv:Användare:Chrizz, CC BY-SA 3.0, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 在划手初期的「抱水 (Catch)」階段至關重要，負責屈肘建立高肘位置（High Elbow）。雖然不是主要推進肌，但決定了抓水的效率。
desc_en: Crucial during the initial 'Catch' phase, flexing the elbow to establish a High Elbow position. While not the primary propulsive muscle, it determines water catching efficiency.

img_source: Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 長距離游泳的耐力推手。在數千次的划手中，持續負責完成每次划手的最後伸直動作，對抗水的黏滯力。
desc_en: The endurance engine for distance swimming. Responsbile for completing the final extension of every stroke over thousands of repetitions against water viscosity.

img_source: Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 游泳推進力的最後一哩路。負責「推水 (Push)」階段的爆發性伸展，將水用力向後推過臀部，是決定划手速度的關鍵肌群。
desc_en: The final mile of swimming propulsion. Responsible for explosive extension during the 'Push' phase, driving water past the hips; a key muscle group for stroke velocity.

img_source: Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 跨越肩關節，協助划手向後的動作。在推水結束後的手臂回覆（Recovery）階段，幫助抬高上臂離開水面。
desc_en: Crosses the shoulder joint, assisting the backward pull. Helps elevate the upper arm out of the water during the recovery phase after the push.

img_source: Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 在划水過程的前半段協助維持手肘彎曲。在長距離游泳中，幫助鎖定手臂角度以對抗強大的水壓阻力。
desc_en: Assists in maintaining elbow flexion during the first half of the stroke. In long-distance swimming, it helps lock the arm angle against substantial water resistance.

img_source: Henry Vandyke Carter, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 維持前臂姿勢。在自由式抓水（Catch）階段，協助穩定手肘與前臂的角度，確保力量能有效施加於水。
desc_en: Maintains forearm posture. During the freestyle catch, assists in stabilizing the elbow-forearm angle to ensure effective force application against the water.

img_source: BodyParts3D/Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 蛙式踢腿的主要動力肌之一。在夾水（Squeeze）階段爆發收縮，將雙腿快速併攏，產生向後的推力。
desc_en: One of the primary power muscles for the breaststroke kick. Explosively contracts during the squeeze phase, snapping legs together to generate backward thrust.

img_source: Me, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 將拇指保持在手掌旁。避免拇指張開導致的「漏水」現象，確保划水面積完整。
desc_en: Keeps the thumb alongside the palm. Prevents water 'leakage' caused by an open thumb, ensuring a complete stroke surface area.

img_source: Was a bee, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 游泳時的「煞車」。若不自覺翹起大拇指，會擾亂經過腳背的水流。應專注於放鬆並讓大拇指與腳背呈一直線。
desc_en: The 'brake' in swimming. Subconscious big toe extension disrupts water flow over the foot. Focus on relaxing and keeping the toe aligned with the instep.

img_source: Polygon data were generated by Database Center for Life Science (DBCLS), CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 主要需保持放鬆伸展。若此肌肉過度收縮（勾腳趾），會破壞壓腳背的流線型，顯著增加水阻。
desc_en: Should remain relaxed and extended. Excessive contraction (dorsiflexing toes) disrupts the pointed-foot streamline, significantly increasing drag.

img_source: Polygon data were generated by Database Center for Life Science (DBCLS)[2], CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 負責足部蹠屈與外翻。在自由式打水時，維持腳掌內八（Internal Rotation of leg, Eversion of foot）的姿勢，以增加推進力。
desc_en: Responsible for plantarflexion and eversion. Maintains the 'pigeon-toed' foot orientation during freestyle kicking to enhance propulsion.

img_source: Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 用力換氣時的輔助肌。游泳者若習慣將頭抬得太高換氣，會導致此肌肉過度使用與肥大，甚至壓迫神經造成手麻。
desc_en: Accessory muscle for forceful breathing. Swimmers who lift their heads too high to breathe overuse and hypertrophy this muscle, potentially compressing nerves and causing hand numbness.

img_source: Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 被稱為「游泳者的肌肉」。負責肩胛骨的旋轉與前伸，允許手臂在入水時盡量向前延伸（Reach）。穩定的肩胛骨是強效划水的基石。
desc_en: Known as the 'Swimmer's Muscle'. Responsible for scapular rotation and protraction, allowing maximum forward Reach upon entry. A stable scapula is the cornerstone of a powerful stroke.

img_source: Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 水中張力指標。游泳換氣時需要嘴部自然張開，若咬肌緊繃（咬牙切齒），會阻礙快速吸氣並導致頸部僵硬下沉。
desc_en: Underwater tension indicator. Breathing requires a naturally open mouth; a tight masseter (clenching) hinders rapid inhalation and causes the neck to stiffen and sink.

img_source: Mikael Häggström, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 抵抗水的阻力，保持手指伸直平坦。在划水過程中，水壓會試圖將手指推向彎曲，此肌肉需持續用力以維持「槳」的形狀。
desc_en: Resists water drag to keep fingers extended and flat. During the stroke, water pressure tries to curl the fingers; this muscle must work to maintain the 'paddle' shape.

img_source: CFCF, CC BY-SA 4.0, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 控制食指外展。協助調整手指間距，以適應不同的水感需求。若過度張開會導致力量分散，需適度控制。
desc_en: Controls index finger abduction. Adjusts finger spacing to adapt to water feel. Excessive spreading dissipates power, so moderate control is needed.

img_source: CFCF, CC BY-SA 4.0, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 穩定中指。中指是划手軌跡的中心軸，此肌肉確保其在水中的穩定性。
desc_en: Stabilizes the middle finger. As the central axis of the stroke trajectory, this muscle ensures its stability in the water.

img_source: CFCF, CC BY-SA 4.0, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 控制無名指位置。與其他骨間肌協同，防止強水流衝散手型。
desc_en: Controls ring finger position. Works with other interossei to prevent strong water currents from disrupting hand shape.

img_source: CFCF, CC BY-SA 4.0, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 控制小指外展。在划手時，防止小指被水流沖開，維持手掌邊緣的完整性。
desc_en: Controls little finger abduction. Prevents the pinky from being pushed out by water flow during the pull, maintaining the integrity of the palm's edge.

img_source: Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 游泳者的「主引擎」。幾乎參與所有泳姿的「抱水後拉（Pull）」動作，提供最強大的推進力。發達的背闊肌形成的倒三角形身材是游泳選手的特徵。
desc_en: The swimmer's 'Main Engine'. Involved in the 'Pull' phase of almost all strokes, providing the strongest propulsion. The V-taper physique from developed lats is a hallmark of swimmers.

img_source: Mikael Häggström, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 確保食指伸直並與其他手指併攏（或保持最佳間隙）。食指是指尖入水的引導點，其穩定性影響入水後的軌跡。
desc_en: Ensures the index finger remains extended and aligned (or optimally spaced). As the guide point for fingertip entry, its stability affects the underwater trajectory.

img_source: BodyParts3D/Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 協助髖屈曲與內收。在自由式打腿中，確保大腿上下擺動時不偏離中線，維持狹窄且有效率的水流通道。
desc_en: Assists in hip flexion and adduction. In freestyle kicking, ensures the thigh moves vertically without deviating from the midline, maintaining a narrow, efficient slipstream.

img_source: DrJanaOfficial, CC BY-SA 4.0, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 游泳推進力的最大來源之一。負責自由式、蝶式與蛙式抱水後拉（Pull）階段的強大內收與內旋力量。過度訓練易導致圓肩。
desc_en: One of the greatest sources of swimming propulsion. Responsible for powerful adduction and internal rotation during the Pull phase of freestyle, butterfly, and breaststroke. Over-training leads to rounded shoulders.

img_source: Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 常見的問題肌肉。游泳者常因胸小肌緊繃導致肩胛骨前傾，造成肩峰下空間變窄，引發夾擠症候群（游泳肩）並限制划手幅度。
desc_en: A problematic muscle. Tightness here in swimmers often tilts the scapula anteriorly, narrowing the subacromial space, causing impingement (Swimmer's Shoulder) and restricting stroke range.

img_source: User:Mikael Häggström, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 在快速且大口吸氣時穩定喉部。游泳比賽中換氣時間極短，此肌肉確保氣管結構穩定不塌陷。
desc_en: Stabilizes the larynx during rapid, deep inhalation. In competitive swimming, breathing windows are tiny; this muscle ensures tracheal stability.

img_source: modified by Uwe Gille, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 協助強力呼氣。在轉身後的水下潛泳階段，幫助控制氣體緩慢且穩定地排出。
desc_en: Assists in forced expiration. Helps control the slow, steady release of air during the underwater streamline phase after a turn.

img_source: Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 自由式換氣的主動肌。負責旋轉頭部露出水面吸氣。若技術不良（抬頭過高而非轉頭），此肌肉會極度疲勞且增加水阻。
desc_en: The prime mover for freestyle breathing. Rotates the head to clear the water for inhalation. Poor technique (lifting instead of turning) exhausts this muscle and increases drag.

img_source: Image:Gray427.png modified, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 微調掌指關節角度。在划水過程中，防止手指過度後伸（Hyperextension），保持扁平或微屈的有效受力面。
desc_en: Fine-tunes MCP joint angle. Prevents finger hyperextension during the pull, maintaining a flat or slightly flexed effective surface area.

img_source: Image:Gray427.png modified, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 維持中指與手掌的平面一致性。抵抗水的壓力，確保力量傳遞不中斷。
desc_en: Maintains alignment between the middle finger and palm plane. Resists water pressure to ensure uninterrupted force transmission.

img_source: Image:Gray427.png modified, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 協助無名指保持正確的划水角度，防止因疲勞而變形。
desc_en: Assists the ring finger in maintaining the correct stroke angle, preventing deformation due to fatigue.

img_source: Image:Gray427.png modified, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 控制小指的微細動作，確保手掌邊緣不會讓水流溜走（Slip）。
desc_en: Controls fine movements of the little finger, ensuring the palm edge doesn't let water slip away.

img_source: Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 容易過度緊張的區域。雖然協助移臂向上，但游泳者應避免習慣性聳肩，否則會增加頸部阻力並限制手臂延伸。
desc_en: Area prone to excess tension. While assisting upward recovery, swimmers must avoid habitual shrugging, which increases neck drag and restricts arm extension.

img_source: Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 游泳流線型姿勢的關鍵。負責下壓肩胛骨，使手臂能貼近耳朵向前延伸（Streamline）。對抗划手時肩膀上聳的傾向。
desc_en: Critical for streamline posture. Depresses the scapula, allowing arms to extend forward close to the ears. Counteracts the tendency to shrug during the pull.

img_source: Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 負責肩胛骨後收。在自由式移臂（Recovery）時，協助抬高肩膀以利提肘。強化此肌肉有助於改善圓肩，增加肺活量。
desc_en: Responsible for scapular retraction. During freestyle recovery, helps elevate the shoulder to facilitate a high elbow. Strengthening here improves rounded shoulders and lung capacity.

img_source: Henry Vandyke Carter, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 啟動前臂的旋前動作。在自由式入水後，立即協助手臂旋轉進入抱水位置，是建立良好划手軌跡的起始點。
desc_en: Initiates forearm pronation. Immediately assists arm rotation into the catch position after freestyle entry, the starting point for a good stroke trajectory.

img_source: Henry Vandyke Carter, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 主要在仰式（Backstroke）的最後推水與空中回臂（Recovery）階段運作。在自由式中，則在空中移臂時幫助手臂放鬆與位置調整。
desc_en: Active primarily during the final push and aerial recovery of Backstroke. In freestyle, assists in arm relaxation and repositioning during the recovery phase.

img_source: BodyParts3D/Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 蛙式選手需特別注意。在收腿階段負責大腿外旋。若過度緊繃，會限制收腿幅度，甚至導致髖部或膝蓋疼痛。
desc_en: Of special concern for breaststrokers. Responsible for thigh external rotation during recovery. If overly tight, it restricts recovery range and can cause hip or knee pain.

img_source: Henry Vandyke Carter, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 負責維持手指併攏與微彎的「杯狀手（Cupping）」（現代游法傾向平掌，但仍需維持手指張力）。對抗強大水壓，防止手指後翻。
desc_en: Maintains finger adduction and slight 'cupping' (though modern technique favors a flatter palm, tension is still needed). Resists water pressure, preventing fingers from bending backward.

img_source: Henry Vandyke Carter, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 提供手掌整體的剛性。在每一下划水中，手掌都必須像一塊堅硬的板子，此肌肉確保持續的張力。
desc_en: Provides overall hand rigidity. During every stroke, the hand must act like a solid board; this muscle ensures continuous tension.

img_source: Polygon data were generated by Database Center for Life Science (DBCLS)[2], CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 游泳時「最不需要」的肌肉之一。若此肌肉緊繃或收縮（勾腳尖），會造成極大的水阻（鋤頭腳）。游泳選手需要極佳的脛前肌伸展性以維持壓腳背姿勢。
desc_en: One of the 'least wanted' muscles in swimming. Tension or contraction (dorsiflexion) creates massive drag (hooked foot). Swimmers require excellent extensibility here to maintain a pointed toe.

img_source: https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/d/df/Inferior_view_of_tibialis_posterior_muscle_-_animation.gif
desc: 協助足內翻。在蛙式踢腿（Breaststroke Kick）的夾水階段提供穩定性，但過度使用容易在強力蹬牆轉身後引發抽筋。
desc_en: Assists in foot inversion. Provides stability during the closing phase of the Breaststroke Kick, but prone to cramping after powerful wall push-offs if overused.

img_source: BodyParts3D/Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 協助蛙式踢腿的「收腿（Recovery）」階段。將大腿外旋以準備進行夾水動作，是蛙式技術細膩度的關鍵肌群。
desc_en: Assists in the 'Recovery' phase of the breaststroke kick. Externally rotates the thigh to prepare for the squeeze, a key muscle for technical finesse in breaststroke.

img_source: BodyParts3D/Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 穩定髖關節。在蛙式踢腿準備動作（收腿外翻）時，保護關節囊，防止因角度過大而受傷。
desc_en: Stabilizes the hip joint. During the breaststroke kick preparation (recovery and eversion), protects the joint capsule from injury due to excessive angles.

img_source: Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 協助划手時的上臂內收動作。特別在自由式的手臂回波（Recovery）轉入入水延伸階段，引導手臂回到中線位置。
desc_en: Assists in arm adduction during the pull. Particularly guides the arm back to the midline during the transition from recovery to entry and extension in freestyle.

img_source: Henry Gray, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 協助屈腕並拉緊手掌筋膜。在划手推水階段，幫助手掌形成穩固的受力面。
desc_en: Assists in wrist flexion and tightens the palmar fascia. Helps the palm form a stable force-bearing surface during the push phase.

img_source: Braus, Hermann, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 負責食指內收。在游泳時，必須持續用力將食指靠攏中指，防止指縫漏水，這是構建有效划手槳面的基礎。
desc_en: Adducts the index finger. Must continuously contract to keep the index finger close to the middle finger, preventing water leakage through gaps; fundamental for building an effective hand paddle.

img_source: Braus, Hermann, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 負責無名指內收。與其他掌側骨間肌共同作用，確保手掌在強大的水阻下維持緊密的鏟狀結構。
desc_en: Adducts the ring finger. Works with other palmar interossei to ensure the hand maintains a tight, scoop-like structure against strong water resistance.

img_source: Braus, Hermann, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 負責小指內收。小指若在划水時外開，會導致嚴重的水流分離（Flow Separation）。此肌肉確保手掌外緣封閉，引導水流向後。
desc_en: Adducts the little finger. If the pinky splays during the stroke, it causes severe flow separation. This muscle ensures the outer edge of the palm remains closed, guiding water backward.

img_source: Henry Vandyke Carter, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 位於小魚際皮下。協助提升手掌內側的皮膚隆起，雖對推進力貢獻微小，但在極限衝刺時協助手掌抓握水感。
desc_en: Located under the hypothenar skin. Assists in raising the skin of the medial palm; while its contribution to propulsion is minimal, it aids in the tactile 'feel' of the water during maximal sprinting.

img_source: modified by Uwe Gille, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 核心底板。協助維持腹內壓（IAP），這對於在水中保持身體剛性（避免像麵條般軟趴趴）至關重要，直接影響浮力與流線型。
desc_en: Core floor. Assists in maintaining intra-abdominal pressure (IAP), vital for keeping body rigidity in water (preventing 'noodling'), directly affecting buoyancy and streamline.

img_source: Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 換氣時的常見代償肌。若轉頭換氣技術不佳而習慣聳肩，此肌肉會過度緊繃導致頸部僵硬，影響呼吸順暢度。
desc_en: Common compensation muscle during breathing. If shrugging occurs due to poor head-turning technique, this muscle becomes tight, causing neck stiffness and impairing breathing flow.

img_source: Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 負責啟動手臂外展（回臂初期）。由於游泳涉及數千次過頂動作，此肌腱極易在肩峰下空間受到夾擠（游泳肩），需注意姿勢控制。
desc_en: Initiates arm abduction (early recovery). Due to thousands of overhead motions in swimming, this tendon is highly prone to subacromial impingement (Swimmer's Shoulder); requires careful posture control.

img_source: Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 肩袖肌群之一，負責外旋。在手臂入水前的剎車階段與空中回臂時穩定肱骨頭，預防肩膀脫位與肌腱炎。
desc_en: Rotator cuff muscle responsible for external rotation. Stabilizes the humeral head during the braking phase before entry and during aerial recovery, preventing dislocation and tendonitis.

img_source: BodyParts3D/Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 蛙式踢腿（Breaststroke Kick）的關鍵肌。在踢水的第二階段（夾腿）負責將大腿強力內收，產生向前的噴射動力。
desc_en: Key muscle for the Breaststroke Kick. Responsible for powerfully adducting the thighs during the second phase (squeeze) of the kick, generating forward jet propulsion.

img_source: Berichard, CC BY-SA 3.0, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 游泳足底抽筋的常見部位。通常因為長時間維持壓腳背（Plantarflexion）姿勢導致縮短而痙攣。放鬆腳趾可緩解。
desc_en: Common site for swimmer's cramp. Often spasms due to shortening from prolonged plantarflexion. Relaxing the toes helps alleviate tension.

img_source: Polygon data were generated by Database Center for Life Science (DBCLS)[2], CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 強化足踝的伸展與外翻。在游泳踢水時，穩固足部結構以對抗水的阻力，確保留暢的鞭狀打腿動作（Whip-like action）。
desc_en: Reinforces ankle extension and eversion. Stabilizes foot structure against water resistance during kicking, ensuring a smooth whip-like kicking action.

img_source: Polygon data were generated by Database Center for Life Science (DBCLS), CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 協助維持腳踝伸直（Plantarflexion）與外翻。在自由式打腿時，幫助腳掌維持良好的迎水角度，增加推進表面積。
desc_en: Assists in maintaining ankle plantarflexion and eversion. Helps orient the foot for optimal water displacement angle during the freestyle kick, increasing propulsive surface area.

img_source: Polygon data were generated by Database Center for Life Science (DBCLS)[2], CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 負責強力的「壓腳背（Plantarflexion）」動作。良好的壓腳背能力能顯著減少足部水阻，是自由式與蝶式踢水推進力的關鍵來源。
desc_en: Responsible for powerful 'toe pointing' (plantarflexion). Good plantarflexion significantly reduces drag; a key source of propulsion in freestyle and butterfly kicking.

img_source: Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 仰式打腿的發動機。負責強力的上踢動作，將大腿向上帶起衝破水阻。同時在轉身蹬牆後，維持身體的筆直剛性。
desc_en: The engine of the backstroke kick. Responsible for the powerful up-kick, driving the thigh upward against water resistance. Also maintains body rigidity after wall push-offs.

img_source: modified by Uwe Gille, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 負責蝶式與蛙式的水下海豚踢（Undulation）動作核心。協助骨盆與肋骨的連動，產生波浪狀的推進力。
desc_en: Core to the underwater dolphin kick (undulation) in butterfly and breaststroke. Assists the linkage between pelvis and ribs to generate wave-like propulsion.

img_source: Henry Vandyke Carter, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 與腹外斜肌協同運作，精確控制水中軀幹的旋轉幅度。在轉身（Flip Turn）時協助快速屈曲與旋轉，是轉身速度的關鍵。
desc_en: Works synergistically with the external oblique to precisely control trunk rotation in water. Assists in rapid flexion and rotation during flip turns, key for turn speed.

img_source: Par Henry Vandyke Carter, CC0, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 游泳「身體滾動 (Body Roll)」的主要驅動者。負責連結划手與打腿的動力鏈，將上半身的旋轉力矩傳遞至核心，減少水阻並增加划距。
desc_en: Primary driver of 'Body Roll' in swimming. Connects the kinetic chain between the pull and the kick, transferring rotational torque to the core to minimize drag and increase stroke distance.

img_source: Mongrangvebet, CC BY-SA 3.0, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 維持水中「流線型 (Streamline)」姿勢的核心。負責在蝶式踢腿與滾翻轉身時的強力屈曲。無力的腹直肌會導致腰部下沉，大幅增加水阻。
desc_en: Core to maintaining the 'Streamline' posture. Responsible for powerful flexion during dolphin kicks and flip turns. Weakness leads to sagging hips, significantly increasing drag.

img_source: modified by Uwe Gille, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 控制水中浮力與平衡的關鍵。透過壓縮腹腔維持剛性，使身體像梭子一樣穿過水面。若此肌肉鬆懈，身體會在水中像麵條般扭曲，力量傳遞效率大減。
desc_en: Key to buoyancy control and balance. Compresses the abdominal cavity to maintain rigidity, allowing the body to cut through water like a shuttle. Without it, the body snakes through water, losing power transfer efficiency.

img_source: Polygon data were generated by Database Center for Life Science (DBCLS)[2], CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 蛙式膝蓋保護者。在蛙式收腿準備外翻時，負責解鎖膝關節並微量內旋脛骨，使小腿能順暢甩動（Whip）。
desc_en: Breaststroke knee protector. During recovery preparation for eversion, unlocks the knee and slightly internalizes the tibia, allowing a smooth whip motion.

img_source: Henry Vandyke Carter, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 在蝶式與蛙式中極為重要，負責將上半身與頭部拉出水面進行換氣。在自由式中則維持身體的水平位置，防止下半身下沉。
desc_en: Crucial in butterfly and breaststroke for lifting the torso and head for breathing. In freestyle, maintains a horizontal body position, preventing the lower body from sinking.

img_source: Me, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 與短肌協同，維持手腕的剛性。在划水（Pull）階段防止手腕因水阻而塌陷，確保力量直接傳遞至前臂。
desc_en: Works with the brevis to maintain wrist rigidity. Prevents the wrist from collapsing under water pressure during the Pull phase, ensuring direct force transfer to the forearm.

img_source: Henry Vandyke Carter, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 在划手全程鎖定手腕。防止手腕在受壓時彎曲（Broken Wrist），確保前臂與手掌形成一個完整的大槳面。
desc_en: Locks the wrist throughout the stroke. Prevents the wrist from collapsing (broken wrist) under pressure, ensuring the forearm and hand act as a single large paddle.

img_source: Henry Vandyke Carter, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 在划手最後的「推水（Push/Finish）」階段發揮關鍵作用。負責快速屈腕，像甩鞭子一樣將水向後最後一推。
desc_en: Critical during the final 'Push/Finish' phase of the stroke. Responsbile for rapid wrist flexion, snapping the water back like a whip for final propulsion.

img_source: Henry Vandyke Carter, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 在水中對抗水壓進行呼吸的引擎。強壯的橫隔膜能增加肺活量，並透過調節腹內壓來控制身體在水中的浮力重心（Lung Buoyancy）。
desc_en: The breathing engine working against water pressure. A strong diaphragm increases lung capacity and regulates intra-abdominal pressure to control the center of buoyancy (Lung Buoyancy).

img_source: Henry Vandyke Carter, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 維持流線型頭部位置（收下巴）的關鍵。抵抗水流衝擊頭部產生的抬頭力矩，減少波浪阻力（Wave Drag）。
desc_en: Key for maintaining a streamlined head position (chin tuck). Resists the head-lifting torque caused by water impact, minimizing wave drag.

img_source: BodyParts3D/Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 蛙式收腿動作（Recovery）的完美執行者。負責屈髖、屈膝並外旋大腿，將腿部帶入正確的蹬踢準備位置。
desc_en: Perfect executor of breaststroke recovery. Flexes hip and knee while externally rotating the thigh, bringing the leg into the correct position for the propulsive kick.

img_source: BodyParts3D/Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 負責自由式與蝶式打腿的「下壓」動作（髖伸展）。更重要的是，它負責將臀部保持在水面附近，防止下半身下沉，減少身體截面積阻力。
desc_en: Responsible for the 'downbeat' (hip extension) in freestyle and butterfly kicking. More importantly, it keeps the hips near the surface, preventing the lower body from sinking and minimizing frontal drag.

img_source: Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 協助髖關節內旋。在自由式打腿時，幫助維持「內八」姿勢，使腳背能有更大的擊水面積。
desc_en: Assists in hip internal rotation. During freestyle kicking, helps maintain the 'pigeon-toed' posture, allowing for a larger surface area on the instep to strike the water.

img_source: Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 在自由式與仰式的「身體滾動（Body Roll）」中穩定骨盆，防止過度擺動。在蛙式踢腿中，協助控制大腿的外展角度。
desc_en: Stabilizes the pelvis during the 'Body Roll' of freestyle and backstroke, preventing excessive swaying. In breaststroke, assists in controlling the abduction angle of the thighs.

img_source: BodyParts3D/Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 蛙式專用肌。在蛙式踢腿的夾水階段（Adduction），與內收肌群共同爆發用力，是蛙式推進力的主要貢獻者之一。
desc_en: Breaststroke specialist. Explosively contracts with the adductor group during the squeeze phase (adduction) of the breaststroke kick; a major contributor to propulsion.

img_source: colorized by Michael Gasperl, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 協助髖屈曲與內旋。在自由式打腿中，幫助維持「內八」姿勢，並透過髂脛束穩定膝蓋在水中的伸直狀態。
desc_en: Assists in hip flexion and internal rotation. In freestyle kicking, helps maintain the 'pigeon-toed' posture and stabilizes knee extension in water via the IT band.

img_source: Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 穩定鎖骨與胸鎖關節。在游泳頻繁的肩部迴旋動作中，作為保護臂叢神經與血管的緩衝墊。
desc_en: Stabilizes the clavicle and SC joint. Acts as a cushion to protect the brachial plexus and vessels during the repetitive shoulder circumduction of swimming.

img_source: User:Mikael Häggström, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 形成口腔底部。在水中閉氣或吞嚥口水時起作用。游泳時應保持此處放鬆，避免頸部不必要的張力。
desc_en: Forms the floor of the mouth. Active during breath holding or swallowing. Should remain relaxed while swimming to avoid unnecessary neck tension.

img_source: Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 負責仰式踢水（Flutter Kick）的「上踢」動作（髖屈曲），這是仰式的主要推進相。在自由式中則負責腿部的放鬆回位。
desc_en: Responsible for the 'up-kick' (hip flexion) in backstroke, which is the primary propulsive phase. In freestyle, it handles the relaxed recovery of the leg.

img_source: Braus, Hermann, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 連接軀幹與下肢的橋樑。在蝶式海豚踢（Dolphin Kick）中，將核心的波浪動能傳遞至腿部，啟動強有力的屈髖動作。
desc_en: The bridge between trunk and legs. In the dolphin kick, it transfers the core's undulatory kinetic energy to the legs, initiating powerful hip flexion.

img_source: Anatomography, CC BY-SA 2.1 JP, via Wikimedia Commons
desc: 游進時應保持放鬆。過度緊張（如因寒冷或費力而咬牙）會消耗氧氣並造成泳後頭痛。面部放鬆有助於全身浮力控制。
desc_en: Should remain relaxed while swimming. Excessive tension (e.g., from cold or effort) consumes oxygen and causes post-swim headaches. Facial relaxation aids in overall buoyancy control.
